intro: Campylocentrum gracile, commonly known as the slender starfruit, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Campylocentrum gracile is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
